Class HighScoresPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • HighScoresPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class HighScoresPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    Panel used to display the high scores to the user and select between the three options (main menu, print, or clear)
    Version:
    5.0.0 06.09.2015 Alex - Updated Time Spent as of June 9, 2015: 3.5 Hours - Making panel and displaying scores - Making buttons work - Making buttons and selector work
    Author:
    Alex Barkin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Method invoked when a key is pressed used to control program flow when a key that is pertanent to the program is pressed
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e- - KeyEvent used to store the value of the key pressed

        Conditional statements:

        1st if structure used to direct which option is selected depending on which key is pressed

        1st if structure in the 1st if structure used to differentiate which option is selected when the general enter key is pressed (checks where selector is)

        2nd if structure in the 1st if structure used to reset the selector to let it go in circles

        3rd if structure in the 1st if structure used to reset the selector to let it go in circles

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Method invoked when a key is released used to undo the effects of keyPressed()
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e- - KeyEvent used to store the value of the key released

        Conditional statements:

        1st if structure used to reverse the key pressed if the key is released

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Method overwritten to fill the requirements of MouseMotionListener and to track where the mouse is when its moved and change the options accordingly

        Conditional statements:

        1st if statement used to change the selector location based on where the cursor is

        1st if statement in the 1st if statement used to only change the cursor if it isnt already that spot

        2nd if statement in the 1st if statement used to only change the cursor if it isnt already that spot

        3rd if statement in the 1st if statement used to only change the cursor if it isnt already that spot

        2nd if statement used to only refresh the screen if something has changed

        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Parameters:
        e- - MouseEvent used to store the value of the tracked mouse

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overwritten paintComponent method used to paint the paint with the specified graphics

        Conditional statements:

        1st if statement used to only draw on the panel if it exists

        2nd if statement used to draw all the highscores one way except the last one

        3rd if statement used to change the hint according to which option is selected

        Loops:

        1st for loop used to run though every high score entry

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g- - Graphics used to hold what to paint on the screen
